item.title: How to ask a question: what you did, what you expected, what happened, your requirements
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Always surprises me how many people ask vague questions on support forums, or on twitter, reddit, etc. Nobody can read your mind :-) !!!!
  • What you did, what you expected, what happened, your requirements <—- if you can concisely state these things, then you are much more likely to get some response! and if not at least you have a more clarity around the issue which is always useful! <– See writing good bug reports
  • I know this requires effort but it’s 100% worth it! And yes not everything is a bug report or software requirements but this is a great framework for questions on the internet in general and for software improvements

item.title: Another great explainer from Victoria Drake: Knapsack problem algorithms for my real-life carry-on knapsack
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Knapsack problem algorithms for my real-life carry-on knapsack <— read it and learn :-) Thanks Victoria Drake!

item.title: Job Interview Questions boil down to three: 1. are you curious? 2. can you use your knowledge when you need it? 3. can you admit what you need to learn?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I’m sure these can be re-phrased differently but these seem to be great questions to ask in any situation not just job interviews!
  • Read the whole thing: Every Interview Question is Really This Question

Pontifications

item.title: Running jekyll serve broke my RSS feed; solution use ruby bundler in production mode
item.description:
Pontifications

  • jekyll serve broke my RSS feed (which Ton discovered, thanks)
  • The solution is to use the ruby bundler in production mode (after setting jekyll up with the ruby bundler as per the official docs: Using Jekyll with Bundler):
    • namely JEKYLL_ENV=production bundle exec jekyll serve

item.title: eleventy static site generator in node and javascript is faster than jekyll?!?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Apparently eleventy is faster and better than jekyll!

item.title: WSL2 doesn't work on ARM 64 Windows 10 because you can't enable the hypervisor in the BIOS
item.description:
Pontifications

  • See wsl 2 on arm linux on build18980.1 WSL github issue #488

item.title: Upgraded this blog to jekyll 4
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Very easy! (official docs for upgrading from jekyll 3 to 4)
    1. Updated the jekyll gem sudo gem update jekyll
    2. And then changed redcarpet to kramdown in _config.yml
